alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 11:43AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MENDOCINO AND SOUTHERN HUMBOLDT COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 PM PST... At 1143 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Rockport, or 13 miles southwest of Richardson Grove State Park, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leggett and Piercy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Mendocino Coast; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior
